page.title: 18 HOUSING : EAST SHEEN
page.content: To the north of the Upper Richmond Road the houses were generally terraced and quite small. They were built between 1890 and 1910. They were also in a very variable state of repair. Some had been refurbished, others were poor and un-cared for. There were few trees down the roads, so they looked rather dull, and this area was definitely less desirable. South of the Upper Richmond Road the houses were more modern, most semi-detached. They were built in the 1930s, and all had large front and back gardens. In the 1920s and 30s there was a great expansion in housing, and more people wanted to live outside London, so the population of East Sheen increased accordingly.
